sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SALZA, Hermann von ( c. 1180-1239), one of the most illustrious knights of the Teutonic order, was a scion of the house of Langensalza in Thuringia, where he was born about 1180. He was a faithful and influential councillor of the emperor Frederick II., and took a prominent part in the contemporary affairs of the German empire. The events of his life are involved in the history of the TEUTONIC Order (q.v.) of which he was elected master in 1210 or 1211.
